Instance.description: A list of loot that will be applied to each sim in the situation if this goal is completed. It must not be used to remove buffs that are added by RoleStates.

TunableTuple.name: add_trait
TunableTuple.description: This loot will add the specified trait.

TunableVariant.name: replace_if_available
TunableVariant.description: The trait to be replaced if the sim has it. If a trait is specified here, this trait will be removed and the trait to add will be added to the index of this removed trait.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The trait that will be removed if the sim has it, it will still be removed even if the trait that needs to be added is not added successfully.

TdescFragTag.name: subject_filter_tests
TdescFragTag.description: These tests will be run once per subject. If the subject participant of this loot action resolves to multiple objects, each of those objects will be tested individually. Any subject that fails this test will be ignored by this loot. This will have no effect on whether we consider the loot to have passed testing on on other subjects or targets. We can use this in cases where we want to give loot based on some criteria like 'All active household members that are dogs get this loot'. These tests will have no effect on 'run tests first' as they are only used for participant filtering and not to determine loot success. The resolver used for these tests is a SingleObjectResolver based on subject sim. This means that test should generally be testing against 'Actor' and should not assume the presence of additional participants that may be present in the containing loot. Ask a GPE if you have questions.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: The test to decide whether the loot action can be applied.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used. e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications. e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

Tunable.name: trait
Tunable.description: The trait to be added.

TunableTuple.name: award_whim_bucks
TunableTuple.description: This loot will give the specified number of whim bucks to the sim.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The sim(s) the operation is applied to.

TunableVariant.description: The tuning file that applied this buff. This is typically tuned to be the same file that this buff is being tuned on. This is NOT player facing, and is used for telemetry only.

TunableTuple.description: Factory created by tuning to represent Simoleon loot payouts.

TunableVariant.name: amount
TunableVariant.description: The amount of Simoleons awarded. The value will be rounded to the closest integer. When two integers are equally close, rounding is done towards the even one (e.g. 0.5 -> 0, 1.5 -> 2). Negative amounts allowed and allow partial deductions (will only take balance to zero, not negative).

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A literal value that is to be used as the lower and upper bound of an interval. This allows both literal and range interval tunings in the same TunableVariant without having to manually set the lower and upper bounds to the same value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The upper and lower bounds.

TunableTuple.name: random_in_range
TunableTuple.description: A tunable interval between lower_bound and upper_bound.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableVariant.name: notification
TunableVariant.description: If set and an amount is awarded, displays a dialog to the user. The notification will have access to the amount awarded as a localization token. e.g. {0.Money}

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a Notification tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.description: A dialog that is displayed as a notification.

TunableVariant.description: If enabled, add additional text to the dialog

If this dialog is using a target sim id to give a conversation type view and this is checked, then the target sim icon will instead be replaced by an anonymous caller.

Tunable.name: immediate_audio
Tunable.description: If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block. ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name_hash

Tunable.name: enabled

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description: If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not. If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played. ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TdescFragTag.name: subject_filter_tests
TdescFragTag.description: These tests will be run once per subject. If the subject participant of this loot action resolves to multiple objects, each of those objects will be tested individually. Any subject that fails this test will be ignored by this loot. This will have no effect on whether we consider the loot to have passed testing on on other subjects or targets. We can use this in cases where we want to give loot based on some criteria like 'All active household members that are dogs get this loot'. These tests will have no effect on 'run tests first' as they are only used for participant filtering and not to determine loot success. The resolver used for these tests is a SingleObjectResolver based on subject sim. This means that test should generally be testing against 'Actor' and should not assume the presence of additional participants that may be present in the containing loot. Ask a GPE if you have questions.

TunableVariant.name: tags
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the simoleons earned will be associated with the listed tags which can be tested against using ObjectiveTests tuning.

TunableEnum.description: The tag associated with this payment

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: The test to decide whether the loot action can be applied.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used. e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications. e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TdescFragTag.name: subject_filter_tests
TdescFragTag.description: These tests will be run once per subject. If the subject participant of this loot action resolves to multiple objects, each of those objects will be tested individually. Any subject that fails this test will be ignored by this loot. This will have no effect on whether we consider the loot to have passed testing on on other subjects or targets. We can use this in cases where we want to give loot based on some criteria like 'All active household members that are dogs get this loot'. These tests will have no effect on 'run tests first' as they are only used for participant filtering and not to determine loot success. The resolver used for these tests is a SingleObjectResolver based on subject sim. This means that test should generally be testing against 'Actor' and should not assume the presence of additional participants that may be present in the containing loot. Ask a GPE if you have questions.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: The test to decide whether the loot action can be applied.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used. e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications. e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableTuple.name: reaction
TunableTuple.description: An operation to play Reaction animations.

Tunable.name: allow_rabbit_holed_sim
Tunable.description: If true we will allow pushing reactions to the sim in rabbit hole.

TunableVariant.name: mixer_reaction
TunableVariant.description: A mixer interaction to push on the subject. This will be attached to the posture's SI so it must meet the constraints of the posture or else it will not run. This interaction should primarily be used to animate the Sim. Mixers are useful for reactions because we can inject them into staging SIs. If an SI Reaction is tuned in addition to this mixer, then the mixer will act as a fallback to the SI.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: ' A reaction mixer that is pushed when this loot op runs. It will only run if an SI reaction is not tuned, fails to run, or does not run in a timely manner.

Tunable.name: affordance
Tunable.description: The affordance to push on the subject.

TunableVariant.name: affordance_target
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the pushed interaction will target a specified participant.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant to be targeted by the pushed interaction.

TunableVariant.name: super_affordance_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this super affordance will be the SI for the reaction mixer. If disabled, we use the posture's SI. Note: This should only be tuned if we are trying to push a SocialMixerInteraction as a reaction mixer. In that case you want to push its SocialSuperInteraction. Furthermore, if the pusher of this reaction is a Social interaction whose SI matches the override type, we'll reuse that SI as the mixer's SI.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The super affordance to use for this reaction mixer.

TunableVariant.name: si_reaction
TunableVariant.description: A Super Interaction that is pushed on the Subject when this loot op is applied. If the SI cannot displace other interactions in the queue and a mixer reaction is tuned, then the mixer will get pushed.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A Super Interaction that is pushed on the Subject when this loot op is applied.

Tunable.name: affordance
Tunable.description: The affordance to push on the subject.

TunableEnum.name: affordance_priority
TunableEnum.description: The priority at which the specified affordance is to be pushed. IMPORTANT: This will cancel any incompatible interactions the Sim is currently running if they are at a lower priority. Autonomous interactions are pushed at Low priority.

TunableVariant.name: affordance_run_priority
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify the priority at which the affordance runs. This may be different than 'affordance_priority'. For example. you might want an affordance to push at high priority such that it cancels existing interactions, but it runs at a lower priority such that it can be more easily canceled.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The run priority for the specified affordance.

TunableVariant.name: affordance_target
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the pushed interaction will target a specified participant.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant to be targeted by the pushed interaction.

TunableVariant.name: override_interaction_source
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, we will override the source of this pushed SI. For example if we don't want a pushed SI to be easily canceled by another user directed interaction, we can set this to be SCRIPT_WITH_USER_INTENT.

TdescFragTag.name: subject_filter_tests
TdescFragTag.description: These tests will be run once per subject. If the subject participant of this loot action resolves to multiple objects, each of those objects will be tested individually. Any subject that fails this test will be ignored by this loot. This will have no effect on whether we consider the loot to have passed testing on on other subjects or targets. We can use this in cases where we want to give loot based on some criteria like 'All active household members that are dogs get this loot'. These tests will have no effect on 'run tests first' as they are only used for participant filtering and not to determine loot success. The resolver used for these tests is a SingleObjectResolver based on subject sim. This means that test should generally be testing against 'Actor' and should not assume the presence of additional participants that may be present in the containing loot. Ask a GPE if you have questions.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: The test to decide whether the loot action can be applied.

TunableVariant.name: text

A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications. e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableTuple.name: remove_buff
TunableTuple.description: This must NOT be used to remove buffs that are added by RoleStates.

TunableList.name: buff_categories_to_remove
TunableList.description: All buffs with at least one of the categories tuned here will be removed from the Sim unless it has any category tuned in Categories To Ignore. This comes from the owning commodity which is the category tuning on the buff in Temporary Commodity Info -> Category or from the buff's owning commodity Categories.

TunableEnum.description: Category to be removed.

If 'remove_all_buffs' is not checked, buffs with any tag in this list will be removed from the subject. If 'remove_all_buffs' is checked, this list will be ignored. You can also specify how many buffs you want to remove by tags in count_to_remove_by_tags

TunableList.name: buffs_to_ignore
TunableList.description: If 'remove_all_buffs' is checked, no buffs included in this list will be removed. If 'remove_all_buffs' is unchecked, this list will be ignored.

Tunable.description: Buff to be removed.

TunableList.name: buffs_to_remove
TunableList.description: If 'remove_all_buffs' is not checked, this is the list of buffs that will be removed from the subject. If 'remove_all_buffs' is checked, this list will be ignored.

Tunable.description: Buff to be removed.

TunableList.name: categories_to_ignore
TunableList.description: If a buff is found from Buff Categories To Remove and has any category from within this list, then it will be ignored and not removed.

TunableEnum.description: Category if found on a buff to make the buff be ignored and not removed.

TunableVariant.name: count_to_remove_by_tags
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, randomly remove x number of buffs specified in buff_tags_to_remove. If disabled, all buffs specified in buff_tags_to_remove will be removed

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: If enabled, randomly remove x number of buffs specified in buff_tags_to_remove. If disabled, all buffs specified in buff_tags_to_remove will be removed

Tunable.name: remove_all_visible_buffs
Tunable.description: If checked, all visible buffs on the Sim, excluding those specified in the 'buffs_to_ignore' list will be removed. If unchecked, buff removal will be handled by the 'buffs_to_remove' list.

TunableTuple.description: Remove all traits from a specific list of traits.

TunableList.description: The list of traits that will be removed.

TunableTuple.name: object_relationship_change
TunableTuple.description: Add to the object relationship score statistic for this Super Interaction.

TunableVariant.TunableTuple: <TunableTuple name="track_range" class="TunableInterval" display="Track Range" description="The relationship track must > lower_bound and <= upper_bound for the operation to apply." group="General">

TunableTuple.name: random_relationship_set
TunableTuple.description: Adds the relationship statistic score about an amount to a random sim selected out of all the known sims for the Actor.

TunableVariant.TunableTuple: <TunableTuple name="track_range" class="TunableInterval" display="Track Range" description="The relationship track must > lower_bound and <= upper_bound for the operation to apply." group="General">

TunableVariant.name: who
TunableVariant.description: Which Sims are valid choices before running tests. If set to known_sims_only then it will only choose between Sims that the subject sim already knows. IF set to all_sims then it will choose between all of the sims, including those that the Sim hasn't met.

TunableTuple.name: relationship_change
TunableTuple.description: Adds to the relationship score statistic for this Super Interaction

TunableVariant.TunableTuple: <TunableTuple name="track_range" class="TunableInterval" display="Track Range" description="The relationship track must > lower_bound and <= upper_bound for the operation to apply." group="General">

TunableTuple.name: relationship_change_multiple
TunableTuple.description: Modifies the relationship track score of multiple tracks at once.

TunableTuple.description: Percent chance that the loot action will be considered. The chance is evaluated just before running the tests.

Tunable.description: The basic chance of success.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_chance.

Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_chance if the associated tests pass.

Tunable.name: hide_relationship
Tunable.description: Sets the relationship's hidden property to this value after a successful interaction.

TunableVariant.name: relationship_multiplier
TunableVariant.description: A multiplier made for relationship operations.

Tunable.name: stat
Tunable.description: The statistic we are operating on.

TdescFragTag.name: subject_filter_tests
TdescFragTag.description: These tests will be run once per subject. If the subject participant of this loot action resolves to multiple objects, each of those objects will be tested individually. Any subject that fails this test will be ignored by this loot. This will have no effect on whether we consider the loot to have passed testing on on other subjects or targets. We can use this in cases where we want to give loot based on some criteria like 'All active household members that are dogs get this loot'. These tests will have no effect on 'run tests first' as they are only used for participant filtering and not to determine loot success. The resolver used for these tests is a SingleObjectResolver based on subject sim. This means that test should generally be testing against 'Actor' and should not assume the presence of additional participants that may be present in the containing loot. Ask a GPE if you have questions.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: The test to decide whether the loot action can be applied.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used. e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications. e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableTuple.name: statistic_change
TunableTuple.description: Modify the value of a statistic.

Tunable.name: amount
Tunable.description: The one-time gain for this operation.

Tunable.name: exclusive_to_owning_si
Tunable.description: If enabled, this gain will be exclusive to the SI that created it and will not be allowed to occur if the sim is running mixers from a different SI. If disabled, this gain will happen as long as this SI is active, regardless of which SI owns the mixer the sim is currently running. This is only effective on Sims.

TunableVariant.name: maximum
TunableVariant.description: A variant containing the different ways you can cap the max amount a statistic reaches as result of a change.

TunableTuple.name: points
TunableTuple.description: The max amount of points that a stat can achieve after an increase.

Tunable.name: max_points
Tunable.description: The point total that a stat cannot go above when increasing. If the increase would go above this point total, instead it will just be equal to this point total.

TunableTuple.name: rank
TunableTuple.description: The max rank a stat can achieve after an increase.

Tunable.name: max_rank
Tunable.description: The rank that a stat cannot go beyond when increasing. If the increase would go beyond achieving this rank, instead it will be set to the min points required to meet this rank. This will prevent any gains toward the next rank from occurring. NOTE: Must be used with a RankedStatistic or it will return 0 as the max.

TunableVariant.name: object_cost_multiplier
TunableVariant.description: When enabled allows you to multiply the stat gain amount based on the value of the object specified.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A construct that determines a multiplier based on the value/cost of an object.

TunableList.name: multiplier_curve
TunableList.description: The multiplier will be determined by interpolating against a curve. The value of the subject in simoleons is used. This means that a curve for cost should have value at its x-axis.

TunableTuple.description: Point on a Curve

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The object whose cost you want to base the multiplier on.

TunableEnum.name: periodic_change_behavior
TunableEnum.description: When applying this change operation at the beginning of an interaction as part of a periodic statistic change and statistic is a continuous statistic, tune the behavior of this operation when interaction begins. Terminology: BaseBehavior: For change operations that succeed chance and test or if chance is 100% or no tests, the statistic stores the start time and when interaction ends determine how much time is passed and multiply amount. Continuous statistic WILL NOT decay with this behavior. This is for better performance. IntervalBehavior: If continuous statistic is using interval behavior. the amount tuned will be given at specified interval if chance and tests succeeds. Continuous statistics WILL decay between interval time. Tuning Behavior APPLY_AT_START_ONLY: If chance and tests for change operation is successful, periodic update will occur and follow BaseBehavior. If either fail, change operation is not given at any point. RETEST_ON_INTERVAL: If test and chance succeeds, then this will follow BaseBehavior. If test or chance fails, this operation will follow interval behavior. APPLY_AT_INTERVAL_ONLY: This will strictly follow Interval Behavior.

Tunable.name: stat
Tunable.description: The statistic we are operating on.

TunableList.name: statistic_multipliers
TunableList.description: Tunables for adding statistic based multipliers to the payout in the format: amount *= statistic.value

TunableTuple.description: A construct that determines a multiplier based on a statistical value.

TunableVariant.name: multiplier
TunableVariant.description: Define how the multiplier will be applied.

TunableList.name: value_curve
TunableList.description: The multiplier will be determined by interpolating against a curve. The user-value is used. This means that a curve for skills should have levels as its x-axis.

TunableTuple.description: Point on a Curve

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: statistic
Tunable.description: The payout amount will be multiplied by this statistic's value.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The participant to look for the specified statistic on.

TdescFragTag.name: subject_filter_tests
TdescFragTag.description: These tests will be run once per subject. If the subject participant of this loot action resolves to multiple objects, each of those objects will be tested individually. Any subject that fails this test will be ignored by this loot. This will have no effect on whether we consider the loot to have passed testing on on other subjects or targets. We can use this in cases where we want to give loot based on some criteria like 'All active household members that are dogs get this loot'. These tests will have no effect on 'run tests first' as they are only used for participant filtering and not to determine loot success. The resolver used for these tests is a SingleObjectResolver based on subject sim. This means that test should generally be testing against 'Actor' and should not assume the presence of additional participants that may be present in the containing loot. Ask a GPE if you have questions.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: The test to decide whether the loot action can be applied.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used. e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications. e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableList.name: tunable_multipliers
TunableList.description: List of multipliers to be applied when gaining amount

TunableTuple.description: A construct that determines a total multiplier value based on tunable tests.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableTuple.name: statistic_change_by_category
TunableTuple.description: Change value of all statistics of a specific category.

TunableTuple.name: chance
TunableTuple.description: Percent chance that the loot action will be considered. The chance is evaluated just before running the tests.

Tunable.name: base_chance
Tunable.description: The basic chance of success.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_chance.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_chance if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

Tunable.name: percent_change_amount
Tunable.description: Percent of current value of statistic should amount be changed. If you want to decrease the amount by 50% enter -50% into the tuning field.

Tunable.name: change_amout
Tunable.description: Amount of change to be applied to statistics that match category.

TunableEnum.name: statistic_category
TunableEnum.description: The category of commodity to remove.

TdescFragTag.name: subject_filter_tests
TdescFragTag.description: These tests will be run once per subject. If the subject participant of this loot action resolves to multiple objects, each of those objects will be tested individually. Any subject that fails this test will be ignored by this loot. This will have no effect on whether we consider the loot to have passed testing on on other subjects or targets. We can use this in cases where we want to give loot based on some criteria like 'All active household members that are dogs get this loot'. These tests will have no effect on 'run tests first' as they are only used for participant filtering and not to determine loot success. The resolver used for these tests is a SingleObjectResolver based on subject sim. This means that test should generally be testing against 'Actor' and should not assume the presence of additional participants that may be present in the containing loot. Ask a GPE if you have questions.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: The test to decide whether the loot action can be applied.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used. e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications. e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableEnum.name: transfer_type
TunableEnum.description: Type of statistic transfer to use.

TunableVariant.name: transfer_type_average_advanced
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the average calculation will be the sum of multiplying the stat value and stat quantity then dividing with total quantity. T = Transferred Stat value S = Stat value QT = Quantity Transferred Stat value QS = Quantity Stat value Result = ((T * QT) + (S * QS)) / (QT + QS) If disabled, the result will calculate Mean of 2 stat values. Result = (T + S) / 2

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Statistic quantities for both subject and donor.

Tunable.name: quantity_stat
Tunable.description: Statistic quantity subject which will be applied to the average calculation.

Tunable.name: quantity_transferred_stat
Tunable.description: Statistic quantity donor which will be applied to the average calculation.

Tunable.name: transferred_stat
Tunable.description: The statistic whose value to transfer.

TunableTuple.name: bullet_list
TunableTuple.description: The token is a string, which is a formatted bullet point list. Objects are grouped by definition. The text for each item must be specified.

Tunable.name: bullet_text
Tunable.description: The text for the bullet entry. The string is provided the following tokens, in this order: 0 An object representitive of the group 1 The number of objects in the group

TunableTuple.name: single
TunableTuple.description: The token is a single object name. If multiple participants are returned, an arbitrary one is used. That is, unless the mismatch key is specified. In that case, the string is used unless all of the participants' definitions match.

TunableVariant.name: mismatch_name
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this is the object name to use when using a multi- object participant yielding definitions with different names.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may NOT require tokens.

TunableTuple.name: from_gardening
TunableTuple.description: The generated objects are those gardening objects that are within the specified distance from the tuned participant.

TunableVariant.name: object_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of gardening object to return.

TunableTuple.name: harvestables
TunableTuple.description: Return all harvestables, i.e. all fruits/flowers parented to plants.

TunableTuple.name: plants
TunableTuple.description: Return all plants.

TunableTuple.name: participant_type_special
TunableTuple.description: The token is a specified string grabbed from a supported participant type that requires special handling. Currently supported are: I. Participants that resolve into households 1. Household Name 2. Household Description 2. Participants that resolve into zone ids 1. Lot Name 2. Lot Description 3. Name of household that lives there 4. Description of household that lives there.

TdescFragTag.name: subject_filter_tests
TdescFragTag.description: These tests will be run once per subject. If the subject participant of this loot action resolves to multiple objects, each of those objects will be tested individually. Any subject that fails this test will be ignored by this loot. This will have no effect on whether we consider the loot to have passed testing on on other subjects or targets. We can use this in cases where we want to give loot based on some criteria like 'All active household members that are dogs get this loot'. These tests will have no effect on 'run tests first' as they are only used for participant filtering and not to determine loot success. The resolver used for these tests is a SingleObjectResolver based on subject sim. This means that test should generally be testing against 'Actor' and should not assume the presence of additional participants that may be present in the containing loot. Ask a GPE if you have questions.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: The test to decide whether the loot action can be applied.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used. e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications. e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableVariant.name: unlock_item
TunableVariant.description: The unlock item that will be given to the Sim. Note that if the item has a custom name, it will not be persisted through the Gallery.
